cards.question: Q: What is the supreme law of the land?
Q: What does the Constitution do?
cards.answer: A: (1) sets up the government (2) defines the government (3) protects basic rights of Americans

cards.question: Q: The idea of self-government is in the first three words of the Constitution. What are these words?
Q: What is an amendment?
cards.answer: A: a change/addition to the Constitution

cards.question: Q: What do we call the first ten amendments to the Constitution?
Q: What is one right or freedom from the First Amendment?
cards.answer: A: speech, religion, assembly, press, petition the government

cards.question: Q: How many amendments does the Constitution have?
Q: What did the Declaration of Independence do?
cards.answer: A: announced/declared our independence from Great Britain

cards.question: Q: What are 2 rights in the Declaration of Independence?
cards.answer: A: life, liberty, pursuit of happiness

cards.question: Q: What is freedom of religion?
cards.answer: A: The freedom to practice any religion, or to not practice a religion

cards.question: Q: What is the economic system in the United States?
Q: What is the 'rule of the law?'
cards.answer: A: Everyone must follow the law, leaders & the government must obey the law; no one is above the low

cards.question: Q: Name one branch or part of the government.
cards.answer: A: Congress, legislative, President, executive, the courts, judicial

cards.question: Q: What stops one branch of government from becoming too powerful?
cards.answer: A: checks and balances, separation of powers

cards.question: Q: Who is in charge of the executive branch?
Q: Who makes federal laws?
cards.answer: A: Congress, Senate and House (of Representatives), (US or National) legislature

cards.question: Q: What are the two parts of the US Congress?
cards.answer: A: The Senate and House (of Representatives)

cards.question: Q: How many US Senators are there?
Q: We elect a US Senator for how many years?
Q: Who is one of your state's US Senators now?
Q: The House of Representatives has how many voting members?
Q: We elect a US Representative for how many years?
Q: Name your US Representative.
cards.answer: A: List of Florida representatives can be found here:

cards.question: Q: Who does a US Senator represent?
cards.answer: A: all people of the state

cards.question: Q: Why do some states have more Representatives than other states?
cards.answer: A: Because some states have more people

cards.question: Q: We elect a President for how many years?
Q: In what month do we vote for the President?
Q: Who is the current President of the United States?
Q: Who is the current Vice President of the United States?
Q: If the President can no longer serve, who becomes President?
Q: If both the President and the Vice President can no longer serve, who becomes President?
cards.answer: A: Speaker of the House (Paul Ryan)

cards.question: Q: Who is the Commander in Chief of the military?
Q: Who signs bills to become laws?
Q: Who vetoes bills?
Q: What does the President's Cabinet do?
Q: What are two Cabinet-level positions?
cards.answer: A: Secretary of Education, Secretary of the Treasury, VP, Secretary of Energy

cards.question: Q: What does the Judicial branch do?
cards.answer: A: reviews laws, explains laws, resolves disputed and decides if a law goes against the Constitution

cards.question: Q: What is the highest court in the United States?
Q: How many justices are on the Supreme Court?
Q: Who is the Chief of Justice of the United States now?
Q: Under our Constitution, some powers belong to the Federal Government. What is one power of the Federal Government?
cards.answer: A: to print money, to declare ware, to create an army and to make treaties

cards.question: Q: Under our Constitution, some powers belong to the states. What is one power of the states?
cards.answer: A: provide schooling and education, provide protection, safety, give a driver's license, approve zoning and land use

cards.question: Q: Who is the Governor of your state now?
Q: What is the capital of your state?
Q: What are the 2 major political parties in the United States?
Q: What is the political party of the President now?
Q: What is the name of the Speaker of the House of Representatives now?
Q: There are four amendments to the Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them.
cards.answer: A: Citizens 18 and older can vote; any citizen can vote

cards.question: Q: What is one responsibility that is only for United States citizens?
cards.answer: A: serve on a jury; vote in a federal election

cards.question: Q: Name one right only for United States citizens.
cards.answer: A: vote in a federal election; run for federal office

cards.question: Q: What are two rights of everyone living in the United States?
cards.answer: A: freedom of speech, religion, expression; the right to bear arms

cards.question: Q: What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?
cards.answer: A: the United States, the flag

cards.question: Q: What is one promise you make when you become a United States Citizen?
cards.answer: A: give up loyalty to other countries, defend the Constitution and laws of the United States

cards.question: Q: How old do citizens have to be to vote for President?
Q: What are two ways that Americans can participate in their democracy?
cards.answer: A: vote, join a political party, publicly support or oppose an issue or policy

cards.question: Q: When is the last day you can send in federal income tax forms?
Q: When must all men register for the Selective Service?
Q: What is one reason colonists came to America?
cards.answer: A: freedom, political liberty, religious freedom, escape persecution

cards.question: Q: Who lived in America before the Europeans arrived?
Q: What group of people was taken to America and sold as slaves?
Q: Why did colonists fight the British?
cards.answer: A: Because of high taxes, because the British army stayed in THEIR houses, and because they didn't have self-government

cards.question: Q: Who wrote the Declaration of Independence?
Q: When was the Declaration of Independence adopted?
Q: There were 13 original states. Name three.
cards.answer: A: Georgia, North Carolina, New York,

cards.question: Q: What happened at the Constitutional Convention?
cards.answer: A: The Constitution was written; The Founding Fathers wrote the Constitution

cards.question: Q: When was the Constitution written?
Q: The Federalist Papers supported the passage of the US Constitution. Name one of the writers.
Q: What is one thing Benjamin Franklin is famous for?
cards.answer: A: US Diplomat, oldest member of the Constitutional Convention, started the first free libraries

cards.question: Q: Who is the 'Father of our Country'?
Q: Who was the first President?
Q: What territory did the US buy from France in 1803?
Q: Name one war fought by the US in the 1800s.
Q: Name the US war between the North and the South.
Q: Name one problem that led to the Civil War.
cards.answer: A: slavery, economic reasons, states' rights

cards.question: Q: What was one important thing that Abraham Lincoln did?
cards.answer: A: freed the slaves (Emancipation Proclamation), saved/preserved the Union, led the US during the Civil War

cards.question: Q: What did the Emancipation Proclamation do?
cards.answer: A: freed the slaves in the Confederate States

cards.question: Q: What did Susan B. Anthony do?
cards.answer: A: fought for women's rights; fought for civil rights

cards.question: Q: Name one war fought by the US in the 1900s.
cards.answer: A: WW I, WW II, Korean War, Vietnam War, (Persian) Gulf War

cards.question: Q: Who was the President during World War I?
Q: Who was the President during the Great Depression and World War II?
Q: Who did the US fight in WW II?
Q: Before he was President, Eisenhower was a general. What war was he in?
Q: During the Cold War, what was the main concern of the US?
Q: What movement tried to end racial discrimination?
Q: What did Martin Luther King, Jr. do?
cards.answer: A: Fought for civil rights, worked for equality for all Americans

cards.question: Q: What major event happened on September 11, 2001, in the United States?
Q: Name one American Indian tribe in the US.?
Q: Name one of the two longest rivers in the US.
Q: What ocean is on the west coast of the United States?
Q: What ocean is on the east coast of the United States?
Q: Name one US territory.
Q: Name one state that borders Canada.
Q: Name one state that borders Mexico.
cards.answer: A: Texas, Arizona, California, New Mexico

cards.question: Q: What is the capital of the United States?
Q: Where is the Statue of Liberty?
cards.answer: A: New York; Liberty Island, Hudson River

cards.question: Q: Why does the flag have 13 stripes?
cards.answer: A: because there were 13 original colonies

cards.question: Q: Why does the flag have 50 stars?
Q: What is the name of the national anthem?
Q: When do we celebrate Independence Day?
Q: Name 2 national US holidays.
cards.answer: A: Independence Day, President's Day, Veteran's Day, Thanksgiving
